revised_title: Early Animal Husbandry and its Evolutionary Implications
tldr: This article discusses the early history of animal husbandry and its significance in understanding human behavior patterns. It highlights the importance of studying man-animal relationships from an archaeological perspective, focusing on the development of close relationships between humans and animals for economic benefits. The author emphasizes the need to examine a wider variety of animals and their exploitation patterns to gain a better understanding of early domestication and animal husbandry practices.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
